Toggle Menu

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack

CloudStack Cloud Module

The CloudStack cloud module is used to control access to a CloudStack based Public Cloud.

depends

libcloud

Use of this module requires the apikey, secretkey, host and path parameters. 

my-cloudstack-cloud-config:
  apikey: <your api key >
  secretkey: <your secret key >
  host: localhost
  path: /client/api
  provider: cloudstack

avail_images

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.avail_images(
								conn=None,
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a dict of all available VM images on the cloud provider with relevant data

avail_locations

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.avail_locations(
								conn=None,
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a dict of all available VM locations on the cloud provider with relevant data

avail_sizes

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.avail_sizes(
								conn=None,
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a dict of all available VM images on the cloud provider with relevant data

block_device_mappings

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.block_device_mappings(
								vm_
								)

Details

Return the block device mapping:

[{'DeviceName': '/dev/sdb', 'VirtualName': 'ephemeral0'},
  {'DeviceName': '/dev/sdc', 'VirtualName': 'ephemeral1'}]

create

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.create(
								vm_
								)

Details

Create a single VM from a data dict

destroy

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.destroy(
								name,
								conn=None,
								call=None
								)

Details

Delete a single VM, and all of its volumes

get_configured_provider

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.get_configured_provider( )

Details

Return the first configured instance.

get_conn

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.get_conn( )

Details

Return a conn object for the passed VM data

get_image

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.get_image(
								conn,
								vm_
								)

Details

Return the image object to use

get_ip

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.get_ip(
								data
								)

Details

Return the IP address of the VM If the VM has public IP as defined by libcloud module then use it Otherwise try to extract the private IP and use that one.

get_key

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.get_key( )

Details

Returns the ssh private key for VM access

get_keypair

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.get_keypair(
								vm_
								)

Details

Return the keypair to use

get_location

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.get_location(
								conn,
								vm_
								)

Details

Return the node location to use

get_networkid

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.get_networkid(
								vm_
								)

Details

Return the networkid to use, only valid for Advanced Zone

get_node

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.get_node(
								conn,
								name
								)

Details

Return a libcloud node for the named VM

get_password

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.get_password(
								vm_
								)

Details

Return the password to use

get_project

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.get_project(
								conn,
								vm_
								)

Details

Return the project to use.

get_size

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.get_size(
								conn,
								vm_
								)

Details

Return the VM's size object

list_nodes

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.list_nodes(
								conn=None,
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a list of the VMs that are on the provider

Syntax

								conn=None,
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a list of the VMs that are on the provider, with all fields

Syntax

								conn=None,
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a list of the VMs that are on the provider, with select fields

Syntax

								vm_
								)

Details

show_instance

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.cloudstack.show_instance(
								name,
								call=None
								)

Details
